Package zork

Class Game

java.lang.Object
zork.Game
public class Game extends Object
This class processes user input and controls the hole game

      public int getDifficulty()

    • setDifficulty

      public void setDifficulty​(int difficulty)

    • play

      public void play​(Player player)
      Main playing method that processes user input, filters possible commands and calls the related methods
      Parameters:
      player - The current player in the game

    • look

      public void look​(String lookingAt)
      Shows information about all ways, things and available items in current room when looking around or shows information about the way for given direction
      Parameters:
      lookingAt - The direction the player is looking at

    • move

      public void move​(String direction)
      Moves in the given direction if it's a valid direction and the way is not blocked
      Parameters:
      direction - The direction the player wants to move

    • take

      public void take​(String itemName)
      Adds item to the players inventory if an item with given name exists in current room and inventory isn't full. If the item is removable it will be removed from current room. Water can not be taken.
      Parameters:
      itemName - from item to take, from user input

    • drop

      public void drop​(String itemName)
      Drops specified item from user Inventory into the current room if that item is in the players inventory. If an item already exists, don't add a new one.
      Parameters:
      itemName - from UserInput.

    • getWayForDirection

      public Way getWayForDirection​(String direction)
      Helper method: Returns the way in the given direction if available (otherwise the way is null)
      Parameters:
      direction - Given direction for looking for ways
      Returns:
      Way if there's a way in the given direction, otherwise return null

    • getCurrentRoom

      public Room getCurrentRoom()
      Helper method: Returns the current room

    • getRoom

      public Room getRoom​(String roomName)
      Get room by its name
      Parameters:
      roomName - Name of the room to look for
      Returns:
      Room is found in game, otherwise return null

    • setDifficultyLevel

      public String setDifficultyLevel​(String input)
      The given input from the player will be set as the difficulty level, loading a saved game is also possible from here
      Parameters:
      input - The user input
      Returns:
      The chosen difficulty level (if player doesn't choose the load option)

    • checkAndProcessPlayersEnergy

      public void checkAndProcessPlayersEnergy()
      Check players health, hunger and thirst level. If hunger or thirst are 0, health will be reduced. If health is 0 and he doesn't get health fill up the player will die (game over). Value of lowerLimit and health increasing are depending on chosen difficulty level. Warning messages will be displayed if levels fall beneath certain values.
